The 'Caspian Sea' (, , , , ) is the largest enclosed inland body of water on
Earth by area, variously classed as the world's largest lake or a full-fledged
sea. The sea has a surface area of (not
including GarabogazkÃ¶l Aylagy) and a volume of . [http://www.worldlakes.org/lakedetails.asp?lakeid=8762 Lake
Profile: Caspian Sea]. LakeNet. It is in an endorheic basin (it has no
outflows) and is bounded to the northwest by Russia, to the west by Azerbaijan,
to the south by Iran, to the southeast by Turkmenistan, and to the northeast by
Kazakhstan.

The ancient inhabitants of its coast perceived the Caspian Sea as an ocean,
probably because of its saltiness and seeming boundlessness. It has a salinity
of approximately 1.2%, about a third the salinity of most seawater. __toc__
